column1: Happy #Thanksgiving to all of my constituents in Georgia's Thirteenth District! Despite these challenging times we have so much to be thankful for. Please stay safe everyone. https://t.co/qrOy9belZX

Thank you @gafarmbureau for presenting the Friend of Farm Bureau of Award to me. I am honored to receive this award for my work to help improve the lives of Georgia farmers and rural communities. https://t.co/zkOujhYCcZ

Today I voted to pass H.R. 8294 the National Apprenticeship Act.  As we face our nation’s deepest economic downturn since the Great Depression we must provide all Americans with opportunities to get back to work. https://t.co/NArNcdtpCC

Now more than ever we must strengthen our school systems to provide a quality education for our children as well as mental health services nutritious breakfast and lunch programs and school safety resources. #AmericanEducationWeek
This American Education Week we honor GA-13 teachers aides and public-school leaders for going above and beyond to support our students during this pandemic. https://t.co/SHYzlJVYTN

My staff was able to help Jerry K. from Smyrna who was stranded in Peru due to COVID-19 lockdowns. Whether you need assistance with a federal agency or if you are trying to find out if federal grants are available for your project my staff and I are here to assist. https://t.co/hfREkP7rx5
I would like to wish all those who celebrate Diwali a happy healthy and joyful celebration. https://t.co/UFfhfMf5SG

With COVID-19 cases rising across Georgia and the U.S. it is more important than ever to remain vigilant stay socially distanced and #MaskUp.   Visit https://t.co/rj6vqcWdnP for information on how to protect yourself and our community. https://t.co/mFOypvd7lM
I am saddened to hear about the passing of Jamar and AnnMari Robinson. My deepest condolences go out to the Robinson family and to the Westlake High School students faculty and alumni.

This #VeteransDay I would like to pay my respects to those who have served in the U.S. Armed Forces. We honor your heroism patriotism and sacrifice for the common good of our nation. Thank you for your service and for protecting the precious freedoms of our Democracy.

Our nation faces the most significant struggles any of us have seen in our lifetime - across rural and urban communities and from young to old. My statement on seeking the Chairmanship of the House Agriculture Committee to address the challenges before us. https://t.co/rZd6Eeb5R7

Thank you to the great people of Georgia’s Thirteenth Congressional District. It is my honor to serve as your U.S. Representative in Congress and I am incredibly proud to take this next step in shaping our future together. https://t.co/DlDrm8stpY

It's not too late to vote! Polling locations for the 2020 General Election are open until 7:00pm in Georgia. For more information on your polling location to report an issue/power outages/long lines or for general questions—call the Voter Protection Hotline at 866-OUR-VOTE. https://t.co/yvSgM8QGTD

Edward B. from Stockbridge recently contacted my office for help with his delayed claim at the Social Security Administration. My team quickly went to work and was able to help Edward activate his Medicare Part B supplemental insurance. https://t.co/t5EDueJewl

This National #FirstResponders Day we honor the brave men and women who serve in law enforcement fire & rescue services emergency medical services emergency management and public works. We cannot thank you enough for your work on the front lines to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/qxxuwqE41c

More than 2.75 million Georgians have already cast their ballot for the November 3rd General Election. This is the final week for early voting. Visit the Secretary of State’s My Voter Page at https://t.co/Z8rej5kZG4 for information on early voting locations and more. https://t.co/ckX0SNA4TP

My staff was able to assist Kandyce G. from Jonesboro with getting in touch with the Office of the Taxpayer Advocate in order to secure her federal tax return with the IRS for her and her son. https://t.co/er4hXQ0azC

My office has received hundreds of calls from frustrated constituents about their delayed applications for unemployment benefits.   This week I led @SanfordBishop @RepHankJohnson and @RepLucyMcBath on a letter urging the @GeorgiaDOL to address their significant backlog. https://t.co/0BemWghtbI

I'm proud to sponsor H.R. 8620 a bill allowing small business owners to make technology improvements under the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). Read my full release here: https://t.co/K7eHIFxy13 https://t.co/X1PgeBxBKS

No one should face eviction during a public health crisis. If you’re having trouble paying rent you may qualify for eviction protection. Visit https://t.co/nuV6gYKJ4m for more information. #KnowYourRights https://t.co/qC3iwhN4lx

Until we are all equal under the law we must continue to fight for LGBTQ protections. Thank you to the @humanrightscampaign for awarding me a perfect score on their congressional scorecard. I pledge to continue working for justice and equality for all. https://t.co/wFMlxE4Kw0 https://t.co/0AODXQPiMq

Preserving access to safe and nutritious food is an essential part of our response to the COVID-19 pandemic particularly for those who have been hit the hardest. This #WorldFoodDay I'm thankful for over 300 farms in GA-13 that help keep fresh and healthy food on our tables. https://t.co/ZZhujqWWZj

The Census determines federal representation and funding for the next DECADE--so respond before it's too late! Visit https://t.co/9lorXivAyy to complete your census and #BeCounted. https://t.co/hOk6IcczyF

My staff was able to assist Evaristus from Stockbridge with getting her daughter's passport in a timely manner. If you live in the Thirteenth District and need assistance with federal casework please contact my office. We are here to serve you. https://t.co/T54S4r0f1P

During the COVID-19 pandemic many women postponed their annual mammograms delaying detection and treatment for breast cancer. I urge women in Georgia to schedule routine screenings because early detection saves lives. https://t.co/dWd5lqvW6t
This #BreastCancerAwareness Month we honor those who have been impacted by breast cancer and raise awareness for cancer that 1 in 8 U.S. women will develop in their lifetime. https://t.co/UVZwJI63Wy
Early voting for the General Election begins today in Georgia and goes through Friday October 30 2020. For more information on your early voting locations and times visit https://t.co/Z8rej5kZG4.
This World #MentalHealth Day I encourage you to check in on a friend or family member and remind them of the resources that are available to treat mental illness. https://t.co/Fa8KIWKyDO

Research suggests that only half of people with a mental health illness receive treatment. As we face increasingly uncertain times it is important to take care of yourself and those who you hold dear.

I am pleased to share that @hudgov has awarded $7947332 in Community Development Block Grants for the Thirteenth District. These grants will be used to help stabilize GA-13 communities facing increased unemployment numbers and eviction rates due to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/84IgBRnUGd

@HUDgov has awarded $7947332 in Community Development Block Grants for the Thirteenth District. These grants will be used to help stabilize GA-13 communities facing increased unemployment numbers and eviction rates due to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/oUJiXpAc8V

I am saddened to hear about the passing of Rudolph “Val” Archer—who was one of the last remaining Tuskegee Airmen. He was a true American hero and I thank him for his years of service to this country.  My thoughts and prayers are with the Archer family. https://t.co/wBtvbLPPiZ

Today I met virtually with GA-13 frontline workers to discuss the need for additional federal funding national safety standards and support to keep them on their feet during this pandemic. https://t.co/xUT2LwTMTm

Today is the last day to register to vote for the November 3rd General Election in Georgia. Whether you plan to vote early by mail or in-person—make sure that you’ve made a plan to ensure that your vote is counted. Visit https://t.co/Z8rej5kZG4 to check your status. https://t.co/SCM93NXPwF

The COVID pandemic has further strained America’s already struggling child care system. That’s why I support the updated #HeroesAct to provide $57 billion to support child care for families nationwide. https://t.co/2q7UR5u3DK

The @HouseDemocrats updated #HEROESAct will help struggling families afford a safe place to live by providing $21 billion in homeowners assistance and $50 billion in rental assistance to the American people. https://t.co/PYzIsrzYl7

The Payroll Support Program is set to expire today and place thousands of flight attendants pilots and other airline workers at risk of having to go without pay. We must pass the Air Carrier Worker Support Extension Act to secure funding for airline workers through March 2021. https://t.co/KomNc5j2aH

Congratulations @StilwellSOA students and teachers on being named a 2020 National Blue Ribbon School by the @usedgov! I'm proud to recognize your exemplary academic achievements and commitment to excellence which earned this distinguished national honor. Keep up the good work! https://t.co/jyfbhPl4vt
G'mar chatima tova to all of my Jewish friends and GA-13 constituents. I wish you all an easy fast during this holy day of restoration and peace. https://t.co/2RrMDSYOdF

The information that you provide on the #2020Census will help your community secure essential funding for the next 10 years. Your voice makes a difference. #ShapeYourFuture and visit https://t.co/gnbO9AIVZQ. https://t.co/eia4keAMAI

On the last Sunday of September we recognize and honor those Mothers who have lost a son or daughter serving in the United States Armed Forces. To all the #GoldStarMothers: Your loved ones will always be remembered and we thank you for your strength and courage.

PCOS is a serious reproductive disorder that affects 1 in 10 women. This #PCOSAwarenessMonth I remain committed to raising awareness and providing the resources that further research and improve treatment options for patients with #PCOS. https://t.co/VmP5FMjPMd

Getting an issue resolved with a federal agency can be confusing and frustrating. Caseworkers on my staff are trained to assist GA-13 constituents by cutting through red tape. If you need assistance please reach out to my local offices to learn how we can #ServeYou. https://t.co/JqxKYDj9Ec

This #SmallBusinessWeek I want to recognize the hardworking entrepreneurs and job creators in #GA13 that make up the backbone of our economy. Over 1.1 million #SmallBiz have been hit hard by COVID and they need our support to keep their doors open. https://t.co/WjUXQiESDB

Today is #NationalVoterRegistration Day. With the general election only 41 days away don't wait to make your plan to vote in person or by mail. Get #VoteReady by visiting https://t.co/uR6sFY0vP8 to check your registration status. https://t.co/57iH3hJsvM

I’d like to thank everyone who came out to our free drive thru COVID-19 testing and food distribution event at Word of Faith Cathedral. Today we saved lives and we will continue working with our partners to provide #COVIDRelief for GA-13. https://t.co/WB3OKqo1uT

I am truly heartbroken to hear of the passing of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Our nation grieves tonight over the loss of this heroic brilliant and relentless champion for justice and equality. Sending my prayers to Justice Ginsburg’s family and friends. https://t.co/NKy1ihJQ8Z

As Jewish families welcome in Rosh Hashanah and the High Holy Days I wish them a sweet happy and healthy new year. I hope that this holiday season offers a chance for reflection on the past year’s challenges and hope for peace and renewal in the year ahead. #ShanaTova https://t.co/g3M3aBoE5r

With the threat of this public health crisis increasingly looming the need to establish protections for pregnant workers is vital. This legislation establishes the clear common sense right to reasonable accommodations and I urge the Senate to take up this bill without delay. https://t.co/PCa7v6GMjb

I am proud to cosponsor the Strength in Diversity Act (H.R. 2639)--which passed in the House yesterday. This bill takes long-overdue steps to advance diversity & inclusion for students of color through essential funding and innovative programming. https://t.co/nkoOALYWZH

This #HispanicHeritageMonth we are proud to celebrate the rich culture and contributions of Hispanic Americans to the United States. As a nation we are strongest when we are dedicated to the principals of equality and when we promote diversity across all aspects of our society. https://t.co/dMchveltSY

Today I joined @atlandco to talk about our FREE Drive-Thru COVID-19 Testing and Food Distribution Event this Saturday at Word of Faith Cathedral in Austell. With over 294000 COVID-19 cases in Georgia we must continue testing to #FlattenTheCurve. https://t.co/RNgNNHZoQ8

Join me next Saturday September 19 from 9:00 to 3:00pm at Word of Faith Cathedral in Austell GA. @FHCGA @CoreResponse @CDPHga & @WellstarHealth will provide free drive-thru COVID-19 Testing & @ACFB will distribute 600 boxes of fresh food and produce. #COVIDRelief https://t.co/k2q4AhbZyd
On Patriot Day our nation pauses to remember and honor the nearly 3000 American lives lost during the terror attacks of September 11 2001. We will #NeverForget. https://t.co/YRyxm8GV1u

Each day 17 veterans reservists and National Guard members die by suicide. This number is far too high. This #SuicidePreventionWeek take a moment to show a veteran you care. #BeThere https://t.co/eXbM1ipmAN

From union laborers to essential workers we honor the contributions of hard-working American men and women to strengthen the prosperity of our state and our country. Wishing all of my GA-13 constituents a safe and happy #LaborDay. https://t.co/OUkx2wh0ts

This #CollegeColorsDay I am proud to highlight my alma mater's orange and green! 1 of 19 land-grant HBCUs @famu_1887 provided me with the foundation to embark on a career of service and I am forever grateful to the institution that helped make me who I am today. #Rattlers https://t.co/Af7ZwXrS6g

Did you know that more than 1 in every 5 Georgia kids live in food insecure households? This #HungerActionMonth join @ACFB and me in taking a stand against hunger. We’ll be at Word of Faith Cathedral on September 19 providing free drive-thru food assistance for 600 families. https://t.co/B7TXqBN56g

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay. Poll workers are critically important to ensure that every vote is counted. Want to get involved? Visit https://t.co/sEUEJAXDzv and sign up to help America vote on November 3rd. https://t.co/BvgI95A1IQ

Service academies provide students with a distinguished and rigorous education. I strongly encourage GA-13 students to contact my office to learn more about the unique opportunities our military academies offer and to apply for a congressional nomination by October 30th 2020. https://t.co/4AVM2FwNdG

You may be eligible for a Henry County Small Business Restart Program grant or a Non-Profit Assistance Program grant funded by the federal CARES Act. Apply today at https://t.co/K9s7pqbPf5 https://t.co/q86BdMLEfa
On Saturday Sept. 19 join me at Word of Faith Cathedral on Riverside Parkway near Six Flags to pick up food and get tested for the viral disease that has swept the globe. https://t.co/AndWtUx19A

I'm joining @CDPHga @FHCGA_ @CoreResponse and @WellstarHealth to provide free Drive-Thru COVID-19 tests on Saturday September 19 at Word of Faith Cathedral. @ACFB will also provide free food assistance for the first 600 families. Register online at https://t.co/YJtMyjSb3z https://t.co/KBcCxo0i2l

Have you taken the #2020Census yet? Federal funding for vital #GA13 programs like schools roads and hospitals is allocated based on census data. #BeCounted by taking the census via phone mail or at https://t.co/wVaxerOZyX by September 30th. https://t.co/Txfe5cdqQq

The #IRS is reopening supplemental Economic Impact Payment registration deadlines to assist those with children. Federal beneficiaries may be eligible to receive $500 per child. Secure the assistance your family needs by 09/31. #COVIDRelief https://t.co/9urhCdkZJU

We cannot stand idly by while this administration seeks to sabotage our Postal Service elections and the foundations of our Democracy. I urge my colleagues to swiftly pass this critical bill. #DontMessWithUSPS https://t.co/R8tekMNg7C

Make a plan to make sure that your vote is counted in the Nov. 3rd General Election. Visit the Secretary of State’s My Voter Page to find information about your voter registration status polling locations key election dates and absentee ballot applications & status. #VoteSafe https://t.co/HV0T8mNQZu
Let us celebrate equality in all its forms and remember those before us who paved the way to change the political and social landscape in our nation.

Today marks the 100th Anniversary of the ratification of the 19th Amendment which guarantees all women the right to vote. I am proud to recognize this milestone in our history for all of the women in Georgia’s Thirteenth District and for all women across the country. https://t.co/xza8jtF4Rr

Thousands of Georgians rely on @USPS everyday to conduct business get lifesaving medications and critical supplies or to exercise their right to vote. We must stop the harmful policies that this Administration is using to delay mail and to dismantle the USPS. #DontMessWithUSPS

Thank you to our partners and participants from our recent COVID-19 testing event. With reports of over 238861 confirmed cases and 4727 deaths in Georgia testing and social distancing are vital to flattening the curve. https://t.co/TkNf1cwBp2

As the Postal Service motto states “Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night stays these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.” Let us uphold these values for all Americans and for the greater good of our nation.
These policies undermine the promises provided for in the Constitution and will have lasting impacts on the American people and postal workers.
This week I joined 172 House Democrats in a letter urging Postmaster General Louis Dejoy to reverse harmful policies that have increased delayed and undelivered mail.
Families who are enrolled in SNAP saw this value reflected in their EBT card balance and those who are not enrolled can apply online to receive support for food-associated costs.

If your child was supposed to receive free or reduced cost school lunches in March 2020 but did not because of the pandemic you may be eligible to receive up to $256.50 per child in P-EBT benefits. https://t.co/ih8bbsEtRR
Together we were able to deliver much needed relief for our community. We look forward to continuing to serve Georgia’s Thirteenth District.

I would like to extend my deepest appreciation to all those who came out in support of our COVID-19 Testing & Food Distribution Event yesterday at Mundy’s Mill High School. Thank you to all of our partners participants public safety personnel and volunteers! https://t.co/kbOBbqovrb

Tomorrow morning we will be saving lives. We will be providing COVID tests to #StopTheSpread of this deadly virus and food assistance to help families impacted by this pandemic. Please come out and join us so that together we can flatten the curve. https://t.co/tlQIqySRy7

I would like to extend a special thanks to Chief Merkison and @CCFES for their exceptional support of our COVID-19 Drive-Thru Testing Event tomorrow. CCFES will be on hand conducting FREE tests and ensuring everyone who attends has a safe experience this weekend. Thank you all! https://t.co/NTpw9bHzSq

Thanks @AtlandCo and @cdpullara for having me on to share information about our free drive-thru COVID-19 testing event coming up this Saturday 8/8. And thanks to @CCFES @FHCGA_ @GABroadcasters @ACFB & @ULGAtl for joining me to discuss the need for testing and food assistance. https://t.co/csl7Lr9tPd

@FHCGA_  provides comprehensive healthcare to Metro Atlanta communities as a Federally Qualified Community Health Center. Led by Dr. Brooks they have played a key role in mitigating the spread of COVID-19 in Georgia and will provide drive-thru tests for GA-13 this Saturday. https://t.co/6tQHrebjia

Rent and mortgages are due for families across Georgia. We must extend the eviction and foreclosure moratoriums & provide urgently needed housing relief.   The #HeroesAct includes:   $100B for emergency rental assistance   $75B for mortgage and utility payment assistance

Every vote MATTERS.    55 years ago President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the #VotingRightsAct to remind us of our nation’s core values. Our fight continues today.   House Democrats will continue our work to protect every American’s right to vote. https://t.co/vsxpsPvDWE

Today I was on @V103Atlanta @TMCV103 with @DjGregStreet and @fhcga CEO Dr. Michael Brooks. We shared how you can get a free COVID-19 test and free fresh food at our drive-thru event this Saturday 8/8 at Mundy’s Mill High School in Clayton County.

Food banks are leading the fight against hunger one meal at a time. Join us this Saturday for our FREE COVID-19 testing and food distribution event where the @ACFB will distribute boxes of fresh food and produce to the first 1500 families while supplies last. https://t.co/eyhxg5RRtn

#NationalWearAMaskDay honors our front line workers and first responders by raising awareness about the importance of wearing a mask. When we all socially distance and wear a mask in public we are helping reduce the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/xY2A3luG71

@HouseAgDems Nearly a quarter of rural Americans still do not have access to fast speed broadband services and COVID-19 has exposed this. We must increase our abilities to connect all citizens to remote education telemedicine and other essential services. #RuralBroadBandDay https://t.co/1BLAeSndXG

Endometriosis affects 1 in 10 women but there’s not enough progress being made toward better treatment or a cure. Today thanks to the work of our House Endometriosis Caucus and @RepFinkenauer we have doubled federal research funding to $26 million for the coming year. #UpEndo

Congressman John Lewis spoke on behalf of the righteous and just. He used his last breaths to advocate for a united and equitable future. May God bless his soul. Rest in power my friend. #GoodTrouble https://t.co/5rJlTQKB9m

Join us at the Thirteenth Congressional District Drive-Thru COVID-19 Testing Event. @CCFES and @FHCGA_ will conduct free Covid-19 testing. @ACFB will distribute fresh food and produce boxes to the first 1500 families. We hope to see you there! #Covid19Testing https://t.co/IHbQiRGnyF

Farmworkers are risking their lives to feed us. They should not be struggling to feed their own families.   We must pass #HEAA2020 to remove the 5-year bar and ensure that no family goes hungry during the #COVID19 pandemic and beyond. https://t.co/uNhQnmcUYC

As we celebrate #ADA30 I join in commemorating the important progress we have made in expanding opportunity and access for Americans with disabilities but our work is far from finished. Let us recommit to the task of full inclusion and equality for Americans with disabilities.

Today I chaired the House Ag. Subcommittee hearing on "Farm Energy Production: Impacts on Farm Income and Rural Communities" to discuss rising energy costs and the benefits and effects of renewable energy on the climate and in communities. https://t.co/uP2bybYqsy @HouseAgDems https://t.co/iJQ7WHpGGN

The act will create thousands of jobs by addressing maintenance backlog for our public lands and national parks. With this legislation we are securing the legacy of the #GreatOutdoors for generations to come.

Today I voted to pass the Great American Outdoors Act bipartisan legislation that will permanently fund the 1964 Land and Water Conservation Fund and protect natural areas and water resources. https://t.co/gFNSLPgb6j

So far in this year my staff and I have secured over a million dollars in casework savings for the constituents of GA-13. Although our offices are closed to visitors due to COVID-19 we are here to #Serve you. Please contact us if you need help with a federal agency or claim. https://t.co/HT7wjWODsx

I will miss my dear friend Congressman John Lewis. One of my fondest memories was visiting the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma with John and Rev. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to boost SNAP Benefits and to support legislation that strengthens the program's effectiveness. #BoostSnapNow

The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) feeds an average of 1.6 million Georgians per month. We cannot let this program expire while Americans are facing hunger food insecurity and the most dire of circumstances due to COVID-19. https://t.co/pfcuOt81TH

Today I join our nation in mourning the passing of my friend Congressman John Lewis. A courageous trailblazer and beloved American hero he took his fight for justice and equality for all from the depths of Bloody Sunday to the halls of Congress and made our world a better place. https://t.co/Husknl2ePN

Today we lost a hero of the civil rights movement. Rev. C.T. Vivian’s legacy goes back more than 60 years in which he played a key role in the 1955 Montgomery Bus Boycott registering black voters and the march in Selma that led to the Voting Rights Act. https://t.co/BVybbmUPkN

Georgia has reported over 120570 confirmed cases and over 3026 deaths. We MUST implement robust testing strategies so that we may overcome this public health crisis together. #WearAMask https://t.co/ySarVIO4HP

I am proud to recognize and celebrate their achievements and I know that our future is bright with this generation at the helm. https://t.co/OG0nzMp8Yu

I want to take this opportunity to wish you and your family a happy 4th of July. Stay safe and be strong. #IndependenceDay https://t.co/MBJjgi1OLt

Thanks to everyone who raised their voice in support of the #GeorgeFloydLaw #JusticeInPolicing Act which passed the House one week ago today. You can continue to weigh in and urge action in the Senate at https://t.co/SVbRpRXFTO.

We can’t tell them to stay inside their homes if they don’t have a home.

Thank you all for the kind birthday wishes!
